page.title: 03HOUSING, INDUSTRY, LEISURE
page.content: The area of Fell Lane and to the east is basically{housing,}the majority being terrace type built either pre-1914 or between the two world wars. These houses were built to accomodate workers for the local industry}which was textiles. To the east of the area there are many{industrial sites,}most of which are the old textile mills which are up to 5 stories high. They now house many small new industries which are not related to{textiles. }They occupy small units within these old buildings. They also include Keighley's last remaining brewery. {Recreation}is catered for in a public park, with bowling greens, and a large play area, a Bingo Hall, clubs, and public houses. There are also many sites for allotment gardens.
